text: I don't think it's important at all to
think of your opponent as your enemy um
for one thing I'm very good friends with
a lot of my opponents at the poker table
I think that you know it's interesting
uh people used to ask me because you
know my brother is such a great poker
player as well Howard letterer and we've
played against each other a lot and I
and I I've knocked him out in some very
high stake
situations and people are like how can
you do that it's your brother you know
how do you do that how do you sit down
at the table and be Cutthroat towards
your
brother and vice versa you know they ask
him the same question and um the answer
is because when you sit down at the
table you understand that you're playing
within rules of the game that that uh
this is a single player game you don't

that I would be breaking the rules if I
played against my brother any
differently than I played against

because people don't realize that I
would consider it cheating uh because

so I'm not supposed to play uh in
concert with anybody else or play
differently toward one person than I

Cutthroat I'm willing to be just because
I have a personal relationship with them

understand that is that when you sit

anybody's an enemy or a friend it's that

at all times so it's neutral to enemy or
not enemy which is kind of an emotional
you know it's like an emotional way to
think about it um it's totally neutral
to that it's you're kind of like an
island unto yourself and the opponents
are only people in as much as they have
patterns that you're trying to analyze
in order to understand what their

because everybody understands that you

to those rules and so everything else
kind of goes out the window so you know
I've been at a table with friends of
mine and they've either like you know
taken tons of money from me or I've
taken tons of money from them and we go

because that was the game and this is
life so like enemy would be a really
